revised_title: Earthquake Shocks in the British Isles and France in August 1892
tldr: This article presents observations of the earthquake shocks that occurred in the British Isles and France during August 1892. The author discusses the wave-length of the disturbances and how they affect the stability of the motion. The text also mentions other topics related to the Royal Society's proceedings, such as plant descriptions, river improvements, and medals.
